abstract: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission to start trading on the New York Stock Exchange on July 15.
snippet: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission to start trading on the New York Stock Exchange on July 15.
lead_paragraph: One of the most eagerly anticipated numbers in finance has finally been revealed. The co-founders of Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, Henry R. Kravis and George R. Roberts, collected a combined $44 million last year, according to a filing on Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. That’s plenty, but a far cry from the $611 million that the Blackstone founders, Stephen A. Schwarzman and Peter G. Peterson, pocketed the year before their private equity firm’s 2007 initial public offering.

headline.main: A Tortuous Journey for Kohlberg Kravis I.P.O.

byline.original: By Jeffrey Goldfarb and John Foley

abstract: The Agricultural Bank of China may be about to go down in the records as the world’s largest initial public offering, MarketWatch writes, but whether the offer will deliver for investors remains far from certain.
snippet: The Agricultural Bank of China may be about to go down in the records as the world’s largest initial public offering, MarketWatch writes, but whether the offer will deliver for investors remains far from certain.
lead_paragraph: The Agricultural Bank of China may be about to go down in the records as the world’s largest initial public offering, MarketWatch writes, but whether the offer will deliver for investors remains far from certain.

abstract: The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the world’s most valuable lender, may raise up to $6.6 billion in new funding, joining Agricultural Bank of China, which on Tuesday raised $19.2 billion in in its initial public offering, Reuters reported.
snippet: The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the world’s most valuable lender, may raise up to $6.6 billion in new funding, joining Agricultural Bank of China, which on Tuesday raised $19.2 billion in in its initial public offering, Reuters report...
lead_paragraph: The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the world’s most valuable lender, may raise up to $6.6 billion in new financing, joining Agricultural Bank of China, which on Tuesday raised $19.2 billion in its initial public offering, Reuters reported, citing sources.

headline.main: I.C.B.C. May Raise $6.6 Billion In New Funding

keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China

abstract: China’s official Xinhua news agency on Tuesday criticized a group of 50 U.S. lawmakers for calling for a probe into Chinese investment in the U.S. steel sector, saying protectionism was rearing its ugly head again.
snippet: China’s official Xinhua news agency on Tuesday criticized a group of 50 U.S. lawmakers for calling for a probe into Chinese investment in the U.S. steel sector, saying protectionism was rearing its ugly head again.
lead_paragraph: China’s official Xinhua news agency on Tuesday criticized a group of 50 United States lawmakers for calling for an investigation into Chinese investment in the American steel industry, saying the action amounted to protectionism, Reuters reported.

headline.main: China Commentary Slams U.S. for Steel Suspicions
